title: Complementary therapies
description: Complementary therapies are defined by the US National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH) as 'a group of diverse medical and health care systems, practices, and products that are not generally considered to be part of conventional medicine. In a palliative care context they are described as evidence based, supportive adjuncts to palliative care used to control or ease symptoms, enhance physical, mental and spiritual well-being, and optimize quality of life for patients and
